intro: Gentiana totorensis, commonly known as the Totoré gentian, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Gentiana totorensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
